title: Re: do you like my forum
content:
It provides nothing that other Doom communities don't have, uses an old, dying (and paid if you don't want ads) forum system and has not / will likely not get a big userbase. So nope.

It's also prety much destined to die out because of above reasons. First, start finding a good forum system. Then make sure that your forums/site provide something unique, something that makes it different from other Doom communities. Then it might catch on.

Looking at the amount of effort you put in things now, I'd say it wouldn't, though!

What's with all those "no" options, btw? Low self-esteem?

EDIT: also, stop posting middle fingers because you can't handle the harshness of people. You kinda asked for it, with all the pretty contentless posts. Also, I usually give some pointers on how to improve your "netiquette" (usage and behaviour on sites and forums).____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: do you like my forum
content:
No. As said, it obviously hasn't been planned very well.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Forum
content:
I'd like to see this forum before I can vote on it.

And I must agree, you have way too many "no" options. A simple "yes" or "no" is probably sufficient. Don't be so negative.
